page.title: 19The Lime Quarry,Ropley.
page.content: The lime quarry covers an area of 6 acres. 10000 tonnes of chalk are transported from the quarry to an area of 30 mile radius & is mainly for spreading on the fields to balance the pH of the soil.The pit was opened in 1945 and they are now working at a depth of 80 ft.Three JCBs are digging the lumps of chalk which are then taken to an elevator where they are crushed.Huge stacks of powdered chalk are stacked in readiness for the busy season which starts after harvest and lasts until about November.The loader scoops the powdered chalk into the back of the lorry which holds 10 tonnes. Then the lorry goes to the farm to spread the chalk over the fields.With a correct pH balance of the soil the farmer gets good crops. It is done every 3-5 years.
